short_description: This function is adopted to convert geometry formats.
long_description: This function is adopted to fetch various file-based geospatial from AFS, parse the format and output them into database relations.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: An empty fact table used to run the function.
input_tables.description: An empty fact table used to run the function.

argument_clauses.name: Path
argument_clauses.rDescription: The AFS directory or file name to fetch the geometry files from (for example, /test or /test/ testfile.xml or /test/*.xml). Regular expressions are allowed in the argument. Before calling this function, make sure that the directories and files you want to specify are available on the AFS system. Note: A zip file is treated as a directory.
argument_clauses.description: The AFS directory or file name to fetch the geometry files from (for example, /test or /test/ testfile.xml or /test/*.xml). Regular expressions are allowed in the argument. Before calling this function, make sure that the directories and files you want to specify are available on the AFS system. Note: A zip file is treated as a directory.

argument_clauses.name: Host
argument_clauses.rDescription: The hostname/ipaddress of the AFS server
argument_clauses.description: The hostname/ipaddress of the AFS server

argument_clauses.name: Port
argument_clauses.rDescription: The port on the AFS server to connect to. The default is 2601.
argument_clauses.description: The port on the AFS server to connect to. The default is 2601.

argument_clauses.name: InputFormat
argument_clauses.rDescription: The format of the geospatial data in the specified files. By default, the function determines the format.
argument_clauses.description: The format of the geospatial data in the specified files. By default, the function determines the format.

argument_clauses.name: OutputFormat
argument_clauses.rDescription: The representation format of geospatial output data. The default value is wkt. Note: Only WKT is supported by the ta.pointinpolygon and ta.geometry.overlay functions.
argument_clauses.description: The representation format of geospatial output data. The default value is wkt. Note: Only WKT is supported by the PointInPolygon and GeometryOverlay functions.

argument_clauses.name: OutputAttributes
argument_clauses.rDescription: The output column names and types. The supported column types are VARCHAR, INT, and DOUBLE PRECISION. The default column type is VARCHAR.
argument_clauses.description: The output column names and types. The supported column types are VARCHAR, INT, and DOUBLE PRECISION. The default column type is VARCHAR.
